hero.title: QuickSite
hero.subtitle: Build and manage websites entirely through a REST API. No frontend framework needed.

api.title: Full API Control
api.desc: 114+ commands to manage every aspect of your site - routes, pages, styles, translations, assets, builds, and more.

i18n.title: Multi-Language
i18n.desc: Built-in internationalization with automatic language detection and easy translation management.

css.title: Dynamic Styling
css.desc: Modify CSS variables, rules, and animations on the fly. No build step required.

build.title: One-Click Deploy
build.desc: Generate production-ready builds with compiled PHP, sanitized configs, and ZIP packaging.

404.message: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.content: This is the privacy policy of our website. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information.

termOfUse.title: Terms of Use
termOfUse.content: These are the terms of use for our website. By using our site, you agree to these terms.

docs.title: API Documentation
docs.intro: Complete reference for all QuickSite management commands. All endpoints require authentication.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.desc: Include your API token in the Authorization header for all requests:

setPublicSpace.desc: Sets the URL space/prefix for the public site. Creates a subdirectory inside the public folder and moves all content there. Use empty destination to restore to root. Note: Site URL changes (e.g., http://domain/web/ when set to "web")

params.destination: URL prefix/space for public site (empty string to remove)

renameSecureFolder.desc: Renames the secure/backend folder at server root level. Updates SECURE_FOLDER_NAME constant. Management URL stays the same.

params.destination: New folder name (single name, no paths)

renamePublicFolder.desc: Renames the public folder at server root level. Updates all references. Requires Apache/web server config update after rename.

params.destination: New folder name (single name, no paths)

addRoute.desc: Creates a new route with PHP page template and empty JSON structure

params.route: Route name for URL (lowercase, numbers, hyphens)

deleteRoute.desc: Deletes an existing route and its associated files (PHP and JSON). Also removes any URL aliases pointing to this route.

getRoutes.desc: Returns list of all available routes in the system

getStructure.desc: Retrieves the JSON structure for a page, menu, footer, or component. Options: showIds (adds node identifiers), summary (tree overview), or nodeId (get specific node by 0-indexed path like 0.2.1)

editStructure.desc: Updates the JSON structure. Two modes: full replacement (send complete structure) or targeted edit (use nodeId + action: update, delete, insertBefore, insertAfter)

params.type: Structure type: page, menu, footer, component
params.name: Name (required for page/component)

listComponents.desc: Lists all reusable JSON components with metadata. Shows available slots (placeholders) and component dependencies.

listPages.desc: Lists all JSON page structures with metadata. Shows route status, components used, and translation keys.

createAlias.desc: Creates a URL redirect alias that points to an existing route. Supports 301 redirects or internal (transparent) routing.

deleteAlias.desc: Deletes an existing URL redirect alias.

listAliases.desc: Lists all URL redirect aliases with their targets and types.

getTranslation.desc: Retrieves translations for a single language

setTranslationKeys.desc: Sets/updates specific translation keys (merge, not replace)

params.translations: Object of keys to add/update (safe merge)

deleteTranslationKeys.desc: Deletes specific translation keys from a language file

params.keys: Array of dot-notation keys to delete

getTranslationKeys.desc: Scans all JSON structures and extracts required translation keys

validateTranslations.desc: Validates translation completeness by comparing required keys with existing translations

getUnusedTranslationKeys.desc: Finds translation keys that exist in translation files but are not used in any structure

analyzeTranslations.desc: Complete translation health check - finds both missing AND unused keys

getLangList.desc: Returns list of configured languages and multilingual settings

setMultilingual.desc: Enable or disable multilingual support. Syncs translations between default.json and default language file.

params.enabled: Boolean: true for multilingual, false for mono-language

checkStructureMulti.desc: Scans all structures for lang-specific content. Use before switching to mono-language mode.

addLang.desc: Adds a new language to the system

deleteLang.desc: Deletes a language from the system

setDefaultLang.desc: Sets the default language for the site

params.lang: Language code to set as default (must exist)

uploadAsset.desc: Uploads a file to the assets folder with validation and automatic naming

params.category: images, scripts, font, audio, or videos

deleteAsset.desc: Deletes a file from the assets folder

listAssets.desc: Lists all files in assets folder with metadata, optionally filtered by category

updateAssetMeta.desc: Updates metadata (description, alt text) for an existing asset. Useful for AI context and accessibility.

params.category: Asset category (images, scripts, font, audio, videos)
params.filename: Name of the file to update metadata for

getStyles.desc: Retrieves the content of the main SCSS/CSS file

editStyles.desc: Updates the content of the main SCSS/CSS file

getRootVariables.desc: Retrieves all CSS custom properties (variables) defined in the :root selector

setRootVariables.desc: Add or update CSS custom properties (variables) in the :root selector

params.variables: Object of CSS variables to set/update

listStyleRules.desc: Lists all CSS selectors in the stylesheet, organized by global and media query scopes

getStyleRule.desc: Get CSS styles for a specific selector, optionally within a media query context

setStyleRule.desc: Add, update, or selectively remove properties from a CSS rule

params.styles: CSS declarations (string or object). Required unless removeProperties is provided
params.removeProperties: Array of CSS property names to remove from the rule

deleteStyleRule.desc: Remove a CSS rule from the stylesheet

listKeyframes.desc: Returns a lightweight list of all @keyframes animation names

getAnimatedSelectors.desc: Returns all CSS selectors using animations, grouped by animation name with orphan detection

getKeyframes.desc: Retrieves all @keyframes animations defined in the stylesheet

params.name: Animation name (alphanumeric)
params.frames: Object with frame keys (0%, 50%, from, to)
params.allowOverwrite: If false, returns error when animation exists (default: true)

deleteKeyframes.desc: Remove a @keyframes animation from the stylesheet

editFavicon.desc: Updates the site favicon with a new image from assets/images folder (PNG only)

editTitle.desc: Updates page title for a specific route and language in the translation file (page.titles.{route} structure)

params.route: Route name to update title for
params.title: New page title text

build.desc: Creates a production-ready build with compiled PHP files, optional folder renaming, config sanitization, and ZIP archive creation

listBuilds.desc: Lists all available builds with metadata including creation date, sizes, languages, and page counts

getBuild.desc: Get detailed info for a specific build including manifest data, file count, and directory contents

deleteBuild.desc: Delete a specific build including both folder and ZIP archive

cleanBuilds.desc: Bulk delete builds older than a specified timestamp with optional dry-run mode

deployBuild.desc: Deploy a build to production paths with file locking and integrity checks

downloadBuild.desc: Get download URL for a build ZIP file with size and manifest info

getCommandHistory.desc: Retrieves command execution history with filtering and pagination. Supports filtering by date, command, status, and token.

clearCommandHistory.desc: Deletes command log files older than a specified date. Shows preview without confirm=true.

params.confirm: Set to true to execute deletion

generateToken.desc: Creates a new API authentication token with specified permissions. Requires admin permission.

listTokens.desc: Lists all API tokens with masked values. Requires admin permission.

revokeToken.desc: Revokes (permanently deletes) an API token. Requires admin permission.

params.token_preview: Token preview from listTokens or full token

help.desc: Returns documentation for all available commands

listProjects.desc: Lists all available projects in the multi-project environment

getActiveProject.desc: Returns the currently active project name

switchProject.desc: Switches to a different project context

params.project: Name of the project to switch to

createProject.desc: Creates a new project from the template

params.name: Name for the new project (lowercase, alphanumeric, hyphens allowed)
params.activate: Whether to switch to the new project after creation (default: false)

deleteProject.desc: Permanently deletes a project and all its files

params.project: Name of the project to delete

exportProject.desc: Creates a ZIP archive of a project for backup or transfer

importProject.desc: Imports a project from a ZIP archive

params.activate: Whether to switch to the imported project (default: false)

downloadExport.desc: Downloads a previously exported project archive

params.filename: Name of the export file to download

clearExports.desc: Clears all exported ZIP files to free disk space

backupProject.desc: Creates a timestamped backup of a project for internal recovery

listBackups.desc: Lists all available backups for a project with size and date info

restoreBackup.desc: Restores a project from a backup (auto-creates pre-restore backup first)

deleteBackup.desc: Deletes a specific backup to free disk space

getSiteMap.desc: Generates a complete sitemap of all routes × all languages for SEO

getSizeInfo.desc: Returns detailed storage information for all project folders

listAiProviders.desc: Lists all supported AI providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Mistral) for BYOK integration

detectProvider.desc: Detects the AI provider from an API key prefix (sk- = OpenAI, sk-ant- = Anthropic)

testAiKey.desc: Tests if an API key is valid by making a minimal API call

params.provider: Provider name (required if key has no detectable prefix)

callAi.desc: Makes an AI completion request via the specified provider (BYOK proxy)

params.provider: Provider to use (openai, anthropic, google, mistral)
params.messages: Chat messages array with role and content

listRoles.desc: Lists all available roles in the system with their command counts

getMyPermissions.desc: Returns the current token's role and accessible commands

createRole.desc: Creates a new custom role with specified commands (superadmin only)

params.name: Role name (lowercase alphanumeric with underscores)
params.commands: Array of command names this role can execute

editRole.desc: Edits an existing role. Builtin roles can only have description changed.

params.name: Name of the role to edit

deleteRole.desc: Deletes a custom role (builtin roles cannot be deleted)

params.name: Name of the role to delete
params.force: Reassign tokens to viewer role if in use

listSnippets.desc: Lists all available snippets (core + project) organized by category

getSnippet.desc: Gets a single snippet with full structure, translations, and CSS

createSnippet.desc: Creates a new user snippet in the project snippets folder

deleteSnippet.desc: Deletes a user snippet (core snippets cannot be deleted)

duplicateSnippet.desc: Copies a core snippet to project snippets for editing

insertSnippet.desc: Inserts a snippet into a page or component with unique textKeys

docs.urlPatternsDesc: All API endpoints follow the pattern /management/{command}. Some commands accept URL path parameters for GET requests - these are shown with the command URL below. Use GET /management/help/{command} for detailed API documentation.

tutorial.title: Getting Started with QuickSite
tutorial.intro: Follow this step-by-step guide to set up your first QuickSite project in minutes.

step1.title: 1. Install Prerequisites
step1.desc: Make sure you have PHP 7.4+ (tested up to 8.4) and a web server (Apache, Nginx, or WAMP/XAMPP) installed on your system.

step2.title: 2. Clone the Repository
step2.desc: Clone the QuickSite template repository from GitHub and configure your web server to point to the public directory.

step3.title: 3. Configure Your Site
step3.desc: Edit the configuration files in the secure/config directory to set up your site name, languages, and API token.

step4.title: 4. Create Your First Route
step4.desc: Use the addRoute API command to create a new page, then add content with the editStructure command.

step5.title: 5. Build & Deploy
step5.desc: Generate a static build of your site using the build command, then upload the files to your hosting provider.

next.title: Next Steps
next.desc: Now that your site is running, explore more features:

projects.title: Project Management
projects.intro: Manage multiple projects within a single QuickSite installation. Create, switch, export, and import projects.

architecture.desc: Projects are stored in secure/projects/{name}. Each project has its own templates, translations, and configuration.

working.desc: Use switchProject to change context. All subsequent API calls operate on the active project until you switch again.

backup.desc: Use exportProject to create ZIP backups. Import them later with importProject to restore or duplicate projects.

i18n.title: Internationalization

add.desc: Add or update translation keys safely. setTranslationKeys performs a deep merge, so existing keys are preserved.

i18n.intro: Build multilingual sites with translation keys. QuickSite supports multiple languages with shared page structures.

health.desc: Check translation completeness across all languages. Find missing keys, unused translations, and get recommendations.

newlang.desc: Add a new language to your site. This creates the translation file and registers the language in config.

actions.desc: Use actions to insert, delete, or move nodes relative to others. insertAfter, insertBefore, and delete give you full control.

showids.desc: Use showIds to see node identifiers for surgical editing. Each node gets a dot-notation ID like 0.2.1 for precise targeting.

json.desc: QuickSite pages are defined as JSON trees. Each node has a tag (HTML element), optional params (attributes), and children (nested elements or text).

nodeid.desc: Target specific nodes for updates using their nodeId. This allows precise edits without replacing the entire structure.

structure.title: Structure Editing
structure.intro: Master the JSON-based page structure system. Every element is a node with tag, params, and children.

deploy.title: Deployment

space.desc: Configure the URL prefix for sites running in a subdirectory. Updates all internal links automatically.

deploy.intro: Build and deploy your site. Create optimized production builds with customizable folder names.

build.desc: Create a timestamped production build. Customize public and secure folder names for your hosting environment.

urls.title: URL Management
urls.intro: Create URL aliases and redirects. Map multiple URLs to the same content or redirect old URLs.

redirect.desc: Create URL mappings with two types: redirect (301 HTTP redirect) or internal (transparent routing).

guides.title: Practical Guides
guides.intro: Learn QuickSite through task-oriented tutorials. Each guide covers related API commands in real-world workflows.

footer.title: Ready to Build?
footer.desc: Explore the full API reference or check out the source code on GitHub.

assets.title: Assets & Branding
assets.intro: Manage media files and branding elements. Upload images, fonts, and other assets via the API.

favicon.desc: Set the site favicon from an uploaded image. The image should be square (ideally 32x32 or larger).

upload.desc: Upload files to categorized folders. Supports images, scripts, fonts, audio, and video files.

pagetitle.desc: Update page titles per language. Titles appear in the browser tab and search results.

security.title: API Security

create.desc: Generate new API tokens with specific permissions. Use * for full access or read for read-only access.

security.intro: Manage API access with tokens. Create, list, and revoke tokens with customizable permissions.

manage.desc: View existing tokens (values masked for security) and revoke tokens that are no longer needed.

css.title: CSS & Theming
css.intro: Control your site's appearance through the API. Manage CSS variables, rules, and animations programmatically.

variables.desc: CSS variables (custom properties) are defined in :root and can be changed instantly across your entire site.

rules.desc: Add or update CSS rules for any selector. Styles are provided as key-value pairs and merged with existing rules.

animations.desc: Create CSS keyframe animations that can be applied to elements using the animation property.

docs.title: API Documentation
docs.intro: Access built-in help for all API endpoints. The help command provides detailed documentation.

help.desc: Get comprehensive documentation for all commands or detailed help for a specific endpoint.

list.desc: View all pages in your project with their metadata, including routes and file locations.

pages.title: Building Pages

create.result: This creates a new page at /about-us with an empty JSON structure ready for content.
create.desc: Use addRoute to create a new page. This creates both the PHP file and the JSON structure file.

pages.intro: Create, list, and delete pages in your QuickSite project. Each page consists of a PHP handler and a JSON structure file.

delete.desc: Remove a page completely. This deletes both the PHP handler and JSON structure file.
